@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

addModule(address,bytes,uint256,uint256,.details: E.G.: On deployment (through the STR) ST gets a TransferManager module attached to itto control restrictions on transfers.You are allowed to add a new moduleType if:- there is no existing module of that type yet added- the last member of the module list is replacable

params._archived: whether to add the module as an archived module
params._budget: max amount of ongoing POLY willing to assign to the module.
params._data: is data packed into bytes used to further configure the module (See STO usage)
params._maxCost: max amount of POLY willing to pay to module. (WIP)
params._moduleFactory: is the address of the module factory to be added

addModuleWithLabel(address,bytes,uint256.details: E.G.: On deployment (through the STR) ST gets a TransferManager module attached to itto control restrictions on transfers.

params._archived: whether to add the module as an archived module
params._budget: max amount of ongoing POLY willing to assign to the module.
params._data: is data packed into bytes used to further configure the module (See STO usage)
params._maxCost: max amount of POLY willing to pay to the module.
params._moduleFactory: is the address of the module factory to be added

params._operator: An address which is being authorised.
An address which is being authorised
params._partition: The partition to which the operator is authorised

params._checkpointId: Checkpoint ID to query as of

balanceOfByPartition(bytes32,address).return: Amount of tokens as per the given partitions

params._data: The `bytes _data` allows arbitrary data to be submitted alongside the transfer.
params._to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

canTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).return: byte Ethereum status code (ESC)bytes32 Application specific reason code

params._data: Additional data attached to the transfer of tokens
params._from: The address from whom the tokens get transferred.
params._partition: The partition from which to transfer tokens
params._to: The address to which to transfer tokens to.
params._value: The amount of tokens to transfer from `_partition`

canTransferByPartition(address,address,b.return: ESC (Ethereum Status Code) following the EIP-1066 standardApplication specific reason codes with additional detailsThe partition to which the transferred tokens were allocated for the _to address

params._data: The `bytes _data` allows arbitrary data to be submitted alongside the transfer.
params._from: address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._to: address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

canTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,.return: byte Ethereum status code (ESC)bytes32 Application specific reason code

params._dataStore: Address of the token data store

params._increase: True if budget has to be increased, false if decrease

params._wallet: Ethereum address of the treasury wallet

checkPermission(address,address,bytes32).details: Note that IModule withPerm will allow ST owner all permissions anywaythis allows individual modules to override this logic if needed (to not allow ST owner all permissions)

controllerRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,b.details: This function can only be executed by the `controller` address.

params._data: data to validate the transfer. (It is not used in this reference implementation because use of `_data` parameter is implementation specific).
params._operatorData: data attached to the transfer by controller to emit in event. (It is more like a reason string for calling this function (aka force transfer) which provides the transparency on-chain).
params._tokenHolder: The account whose tokens will be redeemed.
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens need to be redeemed.

controllerTransfer(address,address,uint2.details: This function can only be executed by the `controller` address.

params._data: data to validate the transfer. (It is not used in this reference implementation because use of `_data` parameter is implementation specific).
params._from: Address The address which you want to send tokens from
params._operatorData: data attached to the transfer by controller to emit in event. (It is more like a reason string for calling this function (aka force transfer) which provides the transparency on-chain).
params._to: Address The address which you want to transfer to
params._value: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred

freezeIssuance(bytes).details: It MUST NOT be possible to increase `totalSuppy` after this function is called.

getAllDocuments().return: bytes32 List of all documents names present in the contract.

getDocument(bytes32).return: string The URI associated with the document.bytes32 The hash (of the contents) of the document.uint256 the timestamp at which the document was last modified.

params._checkpointId: Checkpoint id at which investor list is to be populated
Checkpoint id at which investor list is to be populated
params._end: Position of investor to stop iteration at
params._start: Position of investor to start iteration from

getModule(address).return: bytes32 Nameaddress Module addressaddress Module factory addressbool Module archiveduint8 Array of module typesbytes32 Module label

getModulesByName(bytes32).return: address[] List of modules with this name

getModulesByType(uint8).return: address[] List of modules with this type

initialize(address).details: Expected to be called atomically with the proxy being created, by the owner of the tokenCan only be called once

isControllable().details: If `isControllable` returns `false` then it always return `false` and `controllerTransfer` / `controllerRedeem` will always revert.
isControllable().return: bool `true` when controller address is non-zero otherwise return `false`.

isIssuable().details: If a token returns FALSE for `isIssuable()` then it MUST always return FALSE in the future. If a token returns FALSE for `isIssuable()` then it MUST never allow additional tokens to be issued.
isIssuable().return: bool `true` signifies the minting is allowed. While `false` denotes the end of minting

isOperator(address,address).return: Whether the `_operator` is an operator for all partitions of `_tokenHolder`

isOperatorForPartition(bytes32,address,a.return: Whether the `_operator` is an operator for a specified partition of `_tokenHolder`

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

issue(address,uint256,bytes).details: It only be called by the token issuer or the operator defined by the issuer. ERC1594 doesn't have have the any logic related to operator but its superset ERC1400 have the operator logic and this function is allowed to call by the operator.

params._data: The `bytes _data` allows arbitrary data to be submitted alongside the transfer.
params._tokenHolder: The account that will receive the created tokens (account should be whitelisted or KYCed).
params._value: The amount of tokens need to be issued

params._data: Additional data attached to the minting of tokens
params._partition: The partition to allocate the increase in balance
params._tokenHolder: The token holder whose balance should be increased
params._value: The amount by which to increase the balance

issueMulti(address[],uint256[]).details: Can only be called by the issuer or STO attached to the token.

params._tokenHolders: A list of addresses to whom the minted tokens will be dilivered
params._values: A list of number of tokens get minted and transfer to corresponding address of the investor from _tokenHolders[] list

params._end: Position of investor to stop iteration at
params._start: Position of investor to start iteration from

operatorRedeemByPartition(bytes32,addres.details: This function can only be called by the authorised operator.

params._data: Additional data attached to the burning of tokens
params._operatorData: Additional data attached to the transfer of tokens by the operator
params._partition: The partition to allocate the decrease in balance.
params._tokenHolder: The token holder whose balance should be decreased
params._value: The amount by which to decrease the balance

params._data: Additional data attached to the transfer of tokens
params._from: The address from which to transfer tokens from
params._operatorData: Additional data attached to the transfer of tokens by the operator
params._partition: The partition from which to transfer tokens.
params._to: The address to which to transfer tokens to
params._value: The amount of tokens to transfer from `_partition`

operatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,addr.return: The partition to which the transferred tokens were allocated for the _to address

params._data: The `bytes _data` it can be used in the token contract to authenticate the redemption.
params._value: The amount of tokens need to be redeemed

params._data: Additional data attached to the burning of tokens
params._partition: The partition to allocate the decrease in balance
params._value: The amount by which to decrease the balance

params._data: The `bytes _data` it can be used in the token contract to authenticate the redemption.
params._tokenHolder: The account whose tokens gets redeemed.
params._value: The amount of tokens need to be redeemed

removeDocument(bytes32).details: Can only be executed by the owner of the contract.

params._name: Name of the document. It should be unique always

params._operator: An address which is being de-authorised
An address which is being de-authorised
params._partition: The partition to which the operator is de-authorised

setDocument(bytes32,string,bytes32).details: Can only be executed by the owner of the contract.

params._documentHash: hash (of the contents) of the document.
params._name: Name of the document. It should be unique always
params._uri: Off-chain uri of the document from where it is accessible to investors/advisors to read.

params._checkpointId: Checkpoint ID to query as of

params._data: Additional data attached to the transfer of tokens
params._partition: The partition from which to transfer tokens
params._to: The address to which to transfer tokens to
params._value: The amount of tokens to transfer from `_partition`

transferByPartition(bytes32,address,uint.return: The partition to which the transferred tokens were allocated for the _to address

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

withdrawERC20(address,uint256).details: Owner can transfer POLY to the ST which will be used to pay for modules that require a POLY fee.

params._tokenContract: Address of the ERC20Basic compliance token

addModule(address,bytes,uint256,uint256,.notice: Function used to attach a module to the security token

addModuleWithLabel(address,bytes,uint256.notice: Attachs a module to the SecurityToken

archiveModule(address).notice: Archives a module attached to the SecurityToken

authorizeOperator(address).notice: Authorises an operator for all partitions of `msg.sender`. NB - Allowing investors to authorize an investor to be an operator of all partitions but it doesn't mean we operator is allowed to transfer the LOCKED partition values. Logic for this restriction is written in `operatorTransferByPartition()` function.

authorizeOperatorByPartition(bytes32,add.notice: Authorises an operator for a given partition of `msg.sender`

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).notice: Queries balance at a specified checkpoint

balanceOfByPartition(bytes32,address).notice: Get the balance according to the provided partitions

canTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Transfers of securities may fail for a number of reasons. So this function will used to understand the cause of failure by getting the byte value. Which will be the ESC that follows the EIP 1066. ESC can be mapped with a reson string to understand the failure cause, table of Ethereum status code will always reside off-chain

canTransferByPartition(address,address,b.notice: The standard provides an on-chain function to determine whether a transfer will succeed, and return details indicating the reason if the transfer is not valid.

canTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,.notice: Transfers of securities may fail for a number of reasons. So this function will used to understand the cause of failure by getting the byte value. Which will be the ESC that follows the EIP 1066. ESC can be mapped with a reson string to understand the failure cause, table of Ethereum status code will always reside off-chain

changeDataStore(address).notice: Allows owner to change data store

changeGranularity(uint256).notice: Allows the owner to change token granularity

changeModuleBudget(address,uint256,bool).notice: Allows owner to increase/decrease POLY approval of one of the modules

changeName(string).notice: Allows owner to change token name

changeTreasuryWallet(address).notice: Allows to change the treasury wallet address

checkPermission(address,address,bytes32).notice: Validate permissions with PermissionManager if it exists, If no Permission return false

controllerRedeem(address,uint256,bytes,b.notice: This function allows an authorised address to redeem tokens for any token holder. The redemption must still respect the balances of the token holder (so the redemption must be for at most `balanceOf(_tokenHolder)` tokens) and potentially also need to respect other transfer restrictions.

controllerTransfer(address,address,uint2.notice: This function allows an authorised address to transfer tokens between any two token holders. The transfer must still respect the balances of the token holders (so the transfer must be for at most `balanceOf(_from)` tokens) and potentially also need to respect other transfer restrictions.

createCheckpoint().notice: Creates a checkpoint that can be used to query historical balances / totalSuppy

disableController(bytes).notice: Used by the issuer to permanently disable controller functionality

freezeIssuance(bytes).notice: Permanently freeze issuance of this security token.

getAllDocuments().notice: Used to retrieve a full list of documents attached to the smart contract.

getCheckpointTimes().notice: Gets list of times that checkpoints were created

getDocument(bytes32).notice: Used to return the details of a document with a known name (`bytes32`).

getInvestors().notice: returns an array of investors NB - this length may differ from investorCount as it contains all investors that ever held tokens

getInvestorsAt(uint256).notice: returns an array of investors at a given checkpoint NB - this length may differ from investorCount as it contains all investors that ever held tokens

getInvestorsSubsetAt(uint256,uint256,uin.notice: returns an array of investors with non zero balance at a given checkpoint

getModule(address).notice: Returns module list for a module type

getModulesByName(bytes32).notice: Returns module list for a module name

getModulesByType(uint8).notice: Returns module list for a module type

getTreasuryWallet().notice: use to return the global treasury wallet

getVersion().notice: Used to get the version of the securityToken

granularity().notice: Provides the granularity of the token

holderCount().notice: Gets the holder count (investors with non zero balance)

isControllable().notice: In order to provide transparency over whether `controllerTransfer` / `controllerRedeem` are useable or not `isControllable` function will be used.

isIssuable().notice: A security token issuer can specify that issuance has finished for the token (i.e. no new tokens can be minted or issued).

isModule(address,uint8).notice: Checks if an address is a module of certain type

isOperator(address,address).notice: Determines whether `_operator` is an operator for all partitions of `_tokenHolder`

isOperatorForPartition(bytes32,address,a.notice: Determines whether `_operator` is an operator for a specified partition of `_tokenHolder`

issue(address,uint256,bytes).notice: This function must be called to increase the total supply (Corresponds to mint function of ERC20).

issueByPartition(bytes32,address,uint256.notice: Increases totalSupply and the corresponding amount of the specified owners partition

issueMulti(address[],uint256[]).notice: issue new tokens and assigns them to the target _tokenHolder.

iterateInvestors(uint256,uint256).notice: generates subset of investors NB - can be used in batches if investor list is large

operatorRedeemByPartition(bytes32,addres.notice: Decreases totalSupply and the corresponding amount of the specified partition of tokenHolder

operatorTransferByPartition(bytes32,addr.notice: Transfers the ownership of tokens from a specified partition from one address to another address

polymathRegistry().notice: Provides the address of the polymathRegistry

redeem(uint256,bytes).notice: This function redeem an amount of the token of a msg.sender. For doing so msg.sender may incentivize using different ways that could be implemented with in the `redeem` function definition. But those implementations are out of the scope of the ERC1594.

redeemByPartition(bytes32,uint256,bytes).notice: Decreases totalSupply and the corresponding amount of the specified partition of msg.sender

redeemFrom(address,uint256,bytes).notice: This function redeem an amount of the token of a msg.sender. For doing so msg.sender may incentivize using different ways that could be implemented with in the `redeem` function definition. But those implementations are out of the scope of the ERC1594.

removeDocument(bytes32).notice: Used to remove an existing document from the contract by giving the name of the document.

removeModule(address).notice: Removes a module attached to the SecurityToken

revokeOperator(address).notice: Revokes authorisation of an operator previously given for all partitions of `msg.sender`. NB - Allowing investors to authorize an investor to be an operator of all partitions but it doesn't mean we operator is allowed to transfer the LOCKED partition values. Logic for this restriction is written in `operatorTransferByPartition()` function.

revokeOperatorByPartition(bytes32,addres.notice: Revokes authorisation of an operator previously given for a specified partition of `msg.sender`

setController(address).notice: Used by the issuer to set the controller addresses

setDocument(bytes32,string,bytes32).notice: Used to attach a new document to the contract, or update the URI or hash of an existing attached document

totalSupplyAt(uint256).notice: Queries totalSupply at a specified checkpoint

transferByPartition(bytes32,address,uint.notice: Transfers the ownership of tokens from a specified partition from one address to another address

transferFromWithData(address,address,uin.notice: Overloaded version of the transferFrom function

transferWithData(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Overloaded version of the transfer function

unarchiveModule(address).notice: Unarchives a module attached to the SecurityToken

upgradeModule(address).notice: Upgrades a module attached to the SecurityToken

withdrawERC20(address,uint256).notice: Allows the owner to withdraw unspent POLY stored by them on the ST or any ERC20 token.
